content: Stocks Investments Asked by David LimAsked on 02 Apr 2019Any stocks that are more applicable for beginners like me?3 answersAnswerBump1

Billy Ko, President - Investment Club at Singapore Institute Of TechnologyLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Hi David!Thank you for your question. And similarly as what others have mentioned, applicable means differently to different people. Depending on your risk appetite, your own beliefs and views on which industries are set to grow and evolve. There are many factors that would affect the suitability of different stocks to different individuals.Also, I noticed you are someone really inquisitive with the many questions posed to the forum members here. I really do appreciate your questions and am sure that Seedly and the other forum members feel the same way too :) But just a spark of curiosity, have you started investing and if not, what is holding you back? Once again, thank you for your activeness in this forum, I'm certain many others have indeed learnt from your questions as well!2 comments1

David Lim03 Apr 2019Hi Billy! Thanks for sharing your thoughts. I have started investing but I would like to move on to more advanced investments since I feel like I'm missing out.Billy Ko03 Apr 2019Thank you so much for your inputs David. Your passion for learning truly amazes me, never stop questioning. Keep up the spirit!

God of WisdomAnswered on 02 Apr 2019What does applicable mean to you?I think beginners shouldn't pick stocks especially when index replication and diversification is so easily available through index funds and ETFs.0 comments1

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019I don't think there are "beginner-level" stocks...There are beginner-friendly types of investment tools though, such as SSB, Robo-advisors, high interest savings account, and ETFs.1 comment0
